physical_examinations.relevant_foundings: On physical examination, the scalp displayed a thick greasy scale and mild vertex alopecia, without erythema. The affected nails were markedly hyperkeratotic with pronounced subungual debris. Mineral oil preparations demonstrated countless Sarcoptes scabei mites from both the scalp and nails, consistent with Norwegian (crusted) scabies.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At follow-up 1 month later, the nails had shown rapid regrowth. After a second mineral oil preparation, rare scabies mites were demonstrated, prompting additional treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Physical examination revealed two edematous, rose-colored, sessile protrusions: one anterior to the anus and one in the vulvar area.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement was noted after topical corticosteroid and emollient therapy. After 2 years of follow-up, minimal lesions of lichen sclerosus et atrophicus remained.
